summary: Tbilisi, Georgia's largest city, is a historic place with a unique name that means "warm location." It was founded over 1,500 years ago and has been an important spot due to its position between Europe and Asia. The city has been ruled by many different groups, which is shown in its mix of different types of architecture. Tbilisi is home to around 1.2 million people and has famous landmarks like Sameba Cathedral and the Narikala Fortress. Its location makes it significant for trade and energy routes.
title: Tbilisi
